author: Special Correspondent
text:
Kirti Azad, MP, who was suspended from the BJP recently, said here on Sunday that he would seek an appointment with Prime Minister Narendra Modi to apprise him of the alleged corruption involved in the affairs of the Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA).

He offered to share with Mr. Modi information on the corruption allegedly involving senior politicians. The statement comes a day after the DDCA filed defamation cases against him and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal.

The MP from Bihar told presspersons that no one could deter him from the fight against corruption in the DDCA. Mr. Azad held the DDCA responsible for the escalation of cost in the renovation of the Feroz Shah Kotla stadium in 2008. He offered to produce more evidence of corruption in DDCA affairs when the defamation case against him came up for hearing.
title: Kirti Azad wants to meet Modi
